fields.description:
Per title.

It should still show an error message but its giving a 500 Server Error and showing NullPointerException.

Adding email addresses to the users involved fixed the problem.
fields.summary: NullPointerException when clicking "email review" when one or more reviewers has no email address
Backup admin page includes all items when de-selecting all
dir tree displays incorrectly if the root folder is an frx

fields.description:
via Geoff:

Editing the revisions, e.g., adding one, gave a review updated notice without changes from other people.

This is not easily reproducable and may be a race condition with polling and updating the frx (when you add the revision).
fields.summary: Editing revisions shows the review updated notification

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
1. Mark all files as reviewed.
2. Create a defect on a file.
3. Complete the review.

Expected (assuming no one else has updated the review in the meantime)
- Should complete without warnings since you created the defect and so see the latest change to the review.

Actual
- You are warned about an unreviewd file, since raising a defect will mark that file as unreviewd for all users (that have that preference setting).
- Also, no UI feedback is given that the file has been marked as unreviewed, so when you apply the filter to view the unreviewed files, you don't see any. Nor is there any review updated notice.
fields.summary: File marked as unreviewed for defect author

clicking through I can only see 7 comments & no unread.
fields.summary: draft comments are shown as unread from the reviews list

fields.description:
via https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2105#c18546

When you the review has been updated and you get a warning about unrevied files or unread comments, the dialog will reload the page with the appropriate file filter applied.

However, this puts you back at the top of the review. We should restore the user to the file/comment they were previously on.

We should also do this for the yellow review updated notice.
fields.summary: Restore user to previous position in review when reloading from a review update
Show "reviews to do" table when closing a review

fields.description:
It would be helpful if the [detailed explanation of notification|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/3.+Changing+your+User+Profile#3.ChangingyourUserProfile-ReviewsTab] can be included in the Crucible user interface, so that user has a better understanding for each option available. For example;
|| State change | Default is 'Yes'. A Crucible review moves through different states e.g: 'Draft', 'Under Review'. An email is sent when the state changes. |
|| Comment added | Default is 'Yes'. An email is sent when a comment is added to a review. |
|| Participant finished | Default is 'Yes'. This option applies for any review where you are a moderator. An email is sent (to you, the Moderator only) when any reviewer has completed their review.|
|| General message | Default is 'Yes'. An email is sent when a reviewer is added or removed from a review, after it has gone into the 'Under Review' state.|
|| My actions | Default is 'No'. If set to 'Yes', an email is sent every time you perform an action on a review. |
fields.summary: Adding more detailed description to the Reviews tab in the user profile

fields.description: Geoff Crain: bug: changing between frxs doesnt reset the position - you can be half way through a file when you jump to it
fields.summary: changing between frxs doesnt reset the position - you can be half way through a file when you jump to it
File-level comments which have been autosaved as draft don't get rendered when posted

fields.description: we can be smarter about which of these we show - eg grey out the jira options when there is no jira attached http://img.skitch.com/20090624-geh7kdtardbf25hb7dgw6m926w.jpg
fields.summary: Grey out menu items when not applicable

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create any crucible review in IE8 browser.
# Select reviewers (enter keyword likes 'a', and it will list down all reviewers with character 'a' inside)
# As the list pop up, the next bottom button 'Suggest Reviewers' will hover part of this list.

This problem doesn't happen in Firefox or Safari or Chrome.
fields.summary: List of Suggested Reviews is being hovered by button "Suggest Reviewers" in IE8

fields.description:
Currently, crucible will save any new review automatically as draft even if nothing was written in. These could create a troublesome works, especially when the administrator needs to clean up the unwanted drafts. 

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Login to Crucible
# Goto My Crucible Dashboard
# Click on *Create New Review* tab at the top-right of screen (don't enter or change any value).
# Click on *Dashbaord* tab the the top-right of screen.
# You will see the draft review just being saved.

It would be great if user can have an option to save it as draft explicitly (e.g. a button, etc)
fields.summary: Provide "Save as Draft" button for new review

fields.description: There's no confirm dialog at the moment. Edit / Delete aren't all that far apart + you don't really delete comments that often
fields.summary: Confirmation when deleting a comment

fields.description: Requires a refresh to make the comments appear. Tested for File level comments, may also occur for other types
fields.summary: Autosaved comments aren't readded to the page dynamically

fields.description:
h4. Summary

Currently, users can subscribe to a [review individually|https://confluence.atlassian.com/crucible/using-review-reminders-298977483.html].

End users are requesting the ability to get notified about reviews or summaries without being listed as a Reviewer. 

h4. Suggested solution: 

To do this, it would be nice to be able to:
# Associate a group mailing list or an individual e-mail address to get notified when an event occurs.
# Or/And, give the ability to subscribe to a list and get notifications periodically; daily, weekly, etc... (similarly to filter subscription in Jira)

h4. Why this is important? 

This should help to give users a clearer overview directly on their email inbox.
fields.summary: Ability to assign Mail-groups to a Crucible Review for e-mailing

fields.description:
Currently, users can configure their notification setting via their [user profile|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE/3.+Changing+your+User+Profile].

If I am a reviewer, I do not want to receive any notification when other reviewers comment on a review, so I can set the "Comment added" off. But how if at the same time I want to receive the comment notification from the author.

It would be good, if we can configure the notification e.g an option for us to select certain people whom we want to receive the notification from
fields.summary: An option to select a list of users that they want to receive the notification from

fields.description: If you pick a whole list of default reviewers they are cleared after you save, edit, save
fields.summary: Admin: Default reviewers are not re-saved

fields.description:
Checking the check box doesn't seem to hide anything

!http://img.skitch.com/20090624-da6kwrjcidwr3yupb81qny2ya7.png!

This is because Chai has starred a repo and committed into it, and those commits trump the "hide my activity" flag


Suggested improvement is to mark downstream items in activity stream as "via starred item X"

Also consider rejigging the checkboxes that contribute to this confusion.
fields.summary: downstream starred items confuse the "hide my activity" feature

fields.description:
For CR-BAM-378 it seems my review status on the left and my actual status is differerent

!http://img.skitch.com/20090624-cg8ujg3y3ifyhfruj9ax8fcn7u.png!
fields.summary: Reviewed status out of sync

fields.description: if a due date exists when revisions are added, it should reset the due date according to the project's default due date, (or if there is no default, +1 day?)
fields.summary: due dates arent updated when new revisions are added

fields.description:
Currently, we can't set tab space per a review, but each individual can set the amount of tab spaces in their profile.

If a person reviews both teams work, i.e. a person reviews 4 space tab and 8 space tab reviews, then it will be good if they can change this setting everytime they switch between reviews from the different teams.
fields.summary: Allow to set tab space per a review

fields.description:
If a comment is made on a line which is not shown in a diff (e.g. because it was made in a prior iteration of the review) then it is not visible.

http://img.skitch.com/20090623-dxsi6jsnqfq4xbhkw9gt1f27r9.jpg

expanding the context shows the comment:

http://img.skitch.com/20090623-pry41rbaja9gru5w4n8837r8iu.jpg
fields.summary: Comments against lines not shown in a diff are not visible

fields.description:
This is crap -- we'll tune it (I don't even know how long it'll take to reach the 1 hour cap).

Created from Crucible comment by Nicolas Venegas: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2084#c18324

Also (from pete):
as discussed in RL assuming you can detect when the window is in focus, I think you could make this a bit dubmer. Say every minute when in focus, every 5 or even 10 minutes when not.

We also want to make sure this fires regardless on window.focus (assuming that exists).
fields.summary: Tune polling period.

fields.description:
The delay should be reset to the minimum (10s here) when you start activetly using the review (again), e.g., adding a comment, marking stuff as read.

Created from Crucible comment by Nicolas Venegas: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2084#c18389
fields.summary: Reset the delay when activetly using the review

fields.description:
This simply shows the warning at the top.

It is going to change: I'll add another panel to the dialog warning about the review being updated.

EDIT: typo

Created from Crucible comment by Nicolas Venegas: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2084#c18318
fields.summary: Add a panel to the complete and summary warning dialogs.

fields.description:
We need to continue polling after you click ignore.
e.g., you get a review update message because someone posted a new comment.
If you click ignore, the next time someone posts a new comment you should get another updated warning.

Currently we stop polling after the first updated warning.

Created from Crucible comment by Nicolas Venegas: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2084#c18390
fields.summary: Continue polling for new changes after clicking ignore

fields.description:
The appearance of the warning is a WIP: it will move from the top of the page to a Gmail style overlay in the bottom right corner.

Created from Crucible comment by Nicolas Venegas: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2084#c18328
fields.summary: Move the warning to a Gmail-style overlay

fields.description:
If you attempt to reply a comment or edit a comment in Safari 4, it results [this error|^error.tiff].

As a workaround, please use Firefox browser until you can upgrade to Crucible 2.0.
fields.summary: Commenting doesn't work in Safari 4

fields.description:
Issues with the handling of Abandoned Reviews

1. There is confusion in terminology with abandoned reviews being referred in places as "Dead". Also when initially abandoning a review, user is asked if they want to "delete" the review.

2. When loading an abandoned review, the edit review dialog pops up automatcically and overs an "Abandon review" button and a "Done" button. The "Done" option has no effect beyond a page load --whilst the "Abandon ..." option causes an error.--

3. Abandoning which is a reversible operation is confirmed by dialog whereas delete, which is not reversible is not.
fields.summary: Abandoned Review Handling

fields.description: This covers the read-only stuff that was reviewed in CR-FE-2090.
fields.summary: CAC documentation for iterative review info from CRUC-1536

fields.description:
The footnote reads:

"Created from crucible comment by Adrian Hempel: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2025#c18428"

The product name should have a capital.
fields.summary: Uncapitalised "crucible" in footnote of JIRA issue created from Crucible comment

fields.description: See screenshot
fields.summary: Sort indicator on "Age" column of reviews dashboard points in the wrong direction
invisible gravitar icons in Safari 3

fields.description: expose completion flags per frx
fields.summary: Add frx-completion flags to REST

fields.description:
The due date field in the edit review form is 

a) ugly
b) way too precise (shows millis when hour is more than adequate)

Also the date picker only lets you choose day anyway.

This same issue also affects various forms in FishEye, but isn't as in your face.
fields.summary: Due date display is too exact.

fields.description:
...rather than just redirecting to the first enabled report 

(it would be unfortunate if that report happened to be a long running report that needed to be unnecessarily traversed to reach some other report)
fields.summary: Crucible reports tab should have splash page

fields.description: at the moment we have to maintain css for them being slightly different. there is no reason why they shouldnt be exactly the same.
fields.summary: find out the css differences between the review dir tree and the existing content dir tree
Review blockers report should be able to be constrained by project

fields.description:
there are some settings which you cant permanently set - eg diff context, hide comments

and the settings you can are difficult to find - eg 'single vs multiple view' is under Reviews, where most people would be looking under 'Display Settings'
fields.summary: display settings for reviews arent intuitive and arent sticky

fields.description:
Linked reviews were in tabs up the top in Crucible 1.6.

Put them back in to where 'Linked Issue' is in the sidebar.
fields.summary: Add linked reviews to the review sidebar.

fields.description:
A number of customers raise issue relating to scaling and how many users/repositories/projects an installation can handle. 

While this varies greatly depending on a customers environment, we should publish some performance benchmarks similar to [confluence|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+3+Performance+improvements]

These should include some estimation of the amount of memory they need to allocate to crucible/fisheye, and the sizing for their sever.
fields.summary: Need Performance Benchmarks for Crucible and Fisheye

fields.description:
When requesting an Ajax dialog, we may have to either
- display the requested dialog if user input is required, or
- redirect to the supplied URL if no user input is required.

In either case, there is currently no visual feedback that we're waiting for the Ajax response for the dialog.
fields.summary: Visual feedback when requesting an Ajax dialog

fields.description:
How about a simple small X in the corner like we do for the firebug warning? I think it would look cleaner and less intrusive, considering that the dialog closes by itself anyway.

Created from crucible comment by Sebastian Ruiz: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-2059#c18209
fields.summary: How about a simple small X in the corner like we do for the firebug warning? I think it would look cleaner and less intrusive, considering that the dialog closes by itself anyway.

fields.description:
We should move the 'Edit Revisions' button to the left of the slider (e.g., in a cog button) so that adding new revisions doesn't move the Edit Revisions button further and futher to the right whilst the dialog remains in the same location.

Created from crucible comment by Nicolas Venegas: https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-1991#c17998
fields.summary: Move the 'Edit Revisions' button to the left of the slider

fields.description: Use atlassian-rest-common title expansion for user lists

fields.summary: error adding files to a review, "edit review" dialog won't close

fields.description:
Vertical scrollbar is OK (refactoring it into two columns is a seperate issue).

Horizontal only shows in IE.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcuts dialog has horizontal scrollbar (IE7)

fields.description:
If other reviewers post comments while you have the review open a message is displayed saying that there are unread comments. This is helpful, but the UI doesn't update to show them and it then looks like Crucible is in error and this diminishes trust.

To overcome this, Seb mentioned that we could compare the on-page comment count to the on-server count and provide feedback in the dialog saying that unread comments need to be loaded to be viewed.

Then Crucible seems to be helping rather than hindering.
fields.summary: Let completing reviewers know that additional 3rd party comments were added since page load

fields.description:
See screenshot.

Introduced when I added extra {{<li>}} elements around the filter submenus to make the HTML valid.
fields.summary: Filter menu CSS broken (IE7)

fields.description:
The green tick icon is slightly misaligned in IE7 for the 'new revisions' added notice in the review comments file controls panel.

Also check if the 'no objective set' notice is misaligned.
fields.summary: Icon misaligned in new stuff added to review notice (IE7)

fields.description:
When the browser window isn't very wide and you open 'Edit Review', the entire dialog gets a scrollbar.

When you scroll, the panel content on the right scrolls as expected, but the tabs stay fixed and get obscured by the panel content.
fields.summary: Edit Review dialog tabs don't scroll

fields.description: The _Later Changesets_ and _End of Changesets_ links in the changesets tab of 'Edit Review' are misaligned.
fields.summary: Links misaligned in changesets tab of Edit Review (IE7)

fields.description:
tried to summarize a review with an active reviewer, got:

http://img.skitch.com/20090617-fcge8k1r4riqj7a286brwyj364.png
fields.summary: IE7: Active reviewer warning dialog lacks buttons

fields.description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Go to administration > Users in a crucible standalone install (not using a crucible evaluation license). 
# Change the display name of an existing user (who originally has access right into Crucible), and click *Save*
# Go back to screen with user list, an asterisk ( * ) is appearing beside the modified user account with message "_Users marked with * do not have permission to use Crucible._" 
# However, this user is still able to access to Crucible dashboard & review.

This asterisk could be confusing in Crucible standalone, since It make no sense that nothing else this user can access if s/he cannot access crucible.

In addition users that have an asterisk next to them can no longer be chosen as reviewers/moderators.
fields.summary: Editing a User in crucible standalone will render an sterisk next to their name

fields.description:
The add to review dialog shows me reviews which Crucible thinks are good matches to add a changeset to iteratively. However, there is no way to add changes to a review which is not "suggested". This is useful when a commit is broken up into smaller commits and there are no common files between changesets.

Suggestion: add a way to search for a specific review (via name or id), and/or show recently created reviews.
fields.summary: Add to existing review should let me choose a specific review of my choosing

fields.description:
When trying to create a review from a project which doesn't have a default repository, I see the following problems:

1.  -Clicking the 'suggestions' tab gives a 500 "javax.el.ELException: Problems calling function 'cru:isPathDir'"- (/)
2. -Choosing a repository doesn't refresh the page, so the changeset and browse tabs don't become available- (couldn't reproduce)
3. When the "Edit Review" dialog is initially displayed, no tab is indicated as selected, because the content comes from the changeset(?) tab, whichshouldn't be shown.
4. -If you choose a repository, then go to the Review Details tab, enter a title, click Done, and then click Edit review, the repository selection wasn't saved.- (this is a problem on Safari 3, but not Firefox)
fields.summary: Review Creation problems -- build-r38118

In IE7, in the collapsed reviewers list in the review page, the participant avatars aren't visibile.

They are visible when expanding the participants list.
fields.summary: Avatars missing in collapsed reviewers list (IE7)

fields.description:
Confluence SCM Plugin doesn't work in Crucible 2.0 Beta 3. 

Steps to reproduce the problem:
# Try to configure the [Crucible plugin|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/QogpCg]
# Once you have done that, you should see [this error|^Error.png] when browsing a repo.
# Also, you will see [this error|^CreateReview.png] when creating a review
fields.summary: Confluence SCM Crucible plugin in 2.0 causes error in the repository page.

The screenshot was taken in IE7 but that is also how it appears in Firefox, so the error lies in the lines sent to the server when creating the comment in IE7.
